intro: Crotalaria racemosa, commonly known as the sicklepod, is an annual herbaceous plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, also known as the legume or pea family, and is characterized by its distinctive spiny pods. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm, featuring trifoliate leaves and yellow flowers arranged in racemes. Its seeds are enclosed in elongated, curved pods, which are a key feature of the species. Crotalaria racemosa is often found in disturbed soils and is considered a weed in agricultural settings.
